revised_title: Spectral Analysis of the Total Solar Eclipse of January 22nd, 1898
tldr: This paper presents the results of a detailed study and measurement of spectra photographed during the total solar eclipse of January 22, 1898. The authors used prismatic cameras to capture the solar spectrum and identified various elements present in the solar corona. The study also discusses the origins of coronal rings and provides a table of wave-lengths and probable origins of the measured lines.
